_header: By a wood as I gone ride / Walking all my self alone
_description: ‘For þi Sunnes Amendes make’ — twelve 8-line stanzas with this refrain

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Bi a wode as I gon rydeWalkynge al mi self
                    alone…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…In heuene of þi sone to haue a sihtAnd heer in
                    eorþe amendes make

BlCottCalAII.First Lines:
By a wylde wodes sydeAs I walked my self a loneA blysse of
                    bryddes me bad a bydeffor cause þere song mo þen
                    sum…
BlCottCalAII.Last Lines:
…In heuen a syȝth of ȝou to se& her to a mendes
                    make
BlCottCalAII.Note:
Written two lines of verse per line of the MS, with slashes to mark line
                    breaks; ‘Amen’ by scribe at end of last line and
                    ‘Explycyt’ by scribe in lower margin, partly cropped, f.
                    69.
BlCottCalAII.Attributed Title:
Make a mendes (by scribe in upper margin, f. 69); Another: Make amends (f.
                    1, sixteenth-century list of contents)

                    makke
